job description:
General Summary

This position is responsible for providing synthetic chemistry support for our small molecule drug discovery projects utilizing standard laboratory techniques and methods, manipulating chemical compounds through synthetic methods, analyzing research data, providing interpretations, contributing to the development of research documentation for publications and/or providing technical reports, papers and/or records.

Key Responsibilities:
  • Responsible for providing research and technical support to one or more Research Scientists.
  • Consistently produces quality/quantity reproducible scientific data and analyses.
Position Specific:
  • Performs experimental procedures with limited supervision.
  • Ability to perform testing, specific techniques and/or analysis and correctly utilize experimental apparatus and equipment specific to department/laboratory.
  • Develops resolutions to an assortment of problems of moderately complex scope
  • Knowledge of Microsoft Office Suites Products and chemical drawing programs
  • May provide input or scientific papers and/or proposals
  • Attend technical staff and departmental meetings
  • May assist with preparation, presentation and follow-up on research proposals, manuscripts and progress reports
  • Will support research led by others
  • Attend technical staff and departmental meetings
  • Observe appropriate safety requirements
Minimum Qualifications:
  • BS in Organic Chemistry or related discipline (with organic chemistry experience)
  • 3 years of related laboratory experience
  • Must have a demonstrated understanding of scientific research and methods
  • Proven ability to work as a member of a team
  • Ability to observe and follow appropriate safety requirements
Preferred Qualifications:
  • MS in Organic Chemistry
  • Medicinal chemistry experience
